instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
Hello guys,

I have a MacBook Air that came in for water damage that does not want to turn on. Customer said keyboard cover was on when water spilled. I opened it up and found almost no corrosion except on some caps. 

C78B7, C78B6 traces of corrosion, almost nothing to be concerned for.
Pin 12 of J6700 connector was a little burned, but seems fine
Checked other parts of the board.. nothing.

All VCores show 0.65 - 0.7 volts. Fan spins when CPU gets hot. I am able to turn off and on using power button. Amp meter shows 0.28 - 0.32 amps coming from type C charger with battery connected.

I tried connecting to Apple Configurator 2 for the first time, but my MacBook doesn't seem to see it.

Any advice?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
Looks like board boots, did you check USB activity?
Check external video too.
Try disconnecting trackpad, also check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
There doesn't seem to be any USB activity. LED light normally blinks, but not in this case - just a solid light. No display on internal or external.

<SIGNAL>SMC_LEFT_LID</SIGNAL> is 0.9 volts and <SIGNAL>SMC_RIGHT_LID</SIGNAL> is 0.9 volts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message: I noticed the <SIGNAL>SMC_RIGHT_LID</SIGNAL> sometimes goes to 1.8 volts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message: Disconnect J6100/700 and check again lid signals; their should be 1.8V suposedlly...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
Ohh okay, so with J6100/700 disconnected, it goes to 0.9 volts for both sides. With it connected, the normal 1.8 volts. I wasn't really thinking when I measured with/without the connections.

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is fine..

Anything to do with T2? What I don't understand is that customer heard a little sizzle when the water went in, but there are barely any liquid traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
Try the board alone on the desk.
Only charger and an USB device to check for activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message: I can confirm USB activity with USB mouse. I tested it alone on desk as well as all parts connected. I also hear the charger connection noise coming from the computer when plugging in the charging cable. The MacBook is pulling 1 - 1.5 amps from the charger which is a pretty good sign. However, no output to external or internal display.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
Intel graphics can be damaged, if no internal/external image at same time.
Any liquid sign around J8500, or backlight area?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
These areas look pristine and has no signs of liquid.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5.12 volts
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> = 12.64 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUCORE_PHASE1</SIGNAL> = 0.89 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUCORE_PHASE2</SIGNAL> = 0.75 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_PHASE2</SIGNAL> = 0.64 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_PHASE1</SIGNAL> = 0.70 volts
<SIGNAL>PVCCIO_PHASE</SIGNAL> = 0.97 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUSA_SW_LL</SIGNAL> = 1.03 volts

Very small traces of corrosion between <RESISTOR>R2728</RESISTOR> / <RESISTOR>R2729</RESISTOR>
Very small traces of corrosion around <DIODE>D8100</DIODE> / <DIODE>D8101</DIODE>

Replaced C78B3, C78B2 because the ends were black on pin 1.

Also pin 12 of the J6700 connector is a little burned.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message: Everything seems to be pointing back to the Intel graphics. Is there anything else that can cause both the internal and external to fail?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
Did you check external video disconnecting internal LCD?
Also be sure the HDMI adapter used is good for this machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
Yes, I checked with and without internal LCD connected. I used a known good type C -> HDMI adapter. We use a couple of these for other MacBooks - working good.

I found corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C7416</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> that deals with Phase 1 CPU VGT. The cap was a little burned on pin 1.

What is <SIGNAL>CPUGT_GL1</SIGNAL>? This shows 0.7 volts (phase 1) and <SIGNAL>CPUGT_GL2</SIGNAL> (phase 2) shows 0 volts.

<SIGNAL>CPUGT_GL1</SIGNAL> = 4.2 volts and <SIGNAL>CPUGT_GL2</SIGNAL> = 0 volts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message: Pins 12 on <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> = 0.08 volts, but when I check pin 12 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> this shows 2.4 volts. I think <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> is bad because when I remove it, both pins are 5 volts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_GLX</SIGNAL> pins are not connected; so no matters the voltage there.

Pin 12 should have PWM signal; but ONLY when the chip receives that signal.
"Pins 12 on <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> = 0.08 volts, but when I check pin 12 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> this shows 2.4 volts"
Did you check the continuity?

As you found corrosion signs on graphics area, this should confirm iGPU damage.
You can put quality flux and heat CPU; before trashing the board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message: I retook measurements and found that it goes to 2.4 volts then goes to 0.08 for both pin 12s. Not good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - MacBook Air Not Booting Black Screen VCore Present
threads.message: Looks like it would power cycle.. 2.4 volts then 0.08 volts after a few seconds. I think the CPU is screwed.
